Class DrawPanel.MouseHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • DrawPanel.MouseHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener, EventListener
    Enclosing class:
    DrawPanel

    private class DrawPanel.MouseHandler
extends MouseAdapter
implements MouseMotionListener
    This Class extends from MouseAdapter and implements MouseMotionListener.
    The class will handle the following mouse events: mouseMoved, mousePressed, mouseReleased, mouseDragged and mouseExited. Each of the events will handle drawing or setting the label.
    See MouseAdapter class: MouseAdapter.
    See MouseMotionListener interface: java.awt.event.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private MouseHandler() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void mouseDragged(MouseEvent event)
      When the mouse will be dragged and it's a Pen new shape will be drawn, if it isn't a Pen the x2,y2 will always update and repaint to give a filling as the shape follows our mouse.
      void mouseExited(MouseEvent event)
      When the mouse will exit the DrawPanel it will set the status label.
      void mouseMoved(MouseEvent event)
      When the mouse will move the mouse coordinates shapes drawn label will update.
      void mousePressed(MouseEvent event)
      When the mouse will be pressed only with the left button a new drawing will start according to previous settings.
      void mouseReleased(MouseEvent event)
      When the mouse will be released only with the left button the new drawing will set.

      • Methods inherited from class java.awt.event.MouseAdapter

        mouseClicked, mouseEntered, mouseWheelMoved

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • mouseMoved

        public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent event)
        When the mouse will move the mouse coordinates shapes drawn label will update.
        See mouseMoved method: MouseMotionListener.mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent).
        Specified by:
        mouseMoved in interface MouseMotionListener
        Overrides:
        mouseMoved in class MouseAdapter
        Parameters:
        event - Holds the current event.

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(MouseEvent event)
        When the mouse will be pressed only with the left button a new drawing will start according to previous settings.
        If max drawing limit has been reached and the unlimit check box isn't selected than a message will prompt.
        See mousePressed method: MouseAdapter.mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent).
        See method used to create new shape: DrawPanel.createShape(int, int, int, int).
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class MouseAdapter
        Parameters:
        event - Holds the current event.

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent event)
        When the mouse will be released only with the left button the new drawing will set.
        If the drawn shape will be invisible it will be released to the garbage collecter.
        See mouseReleased method: MouseAdapter.mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent).
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class MouseAdapter
        Parameters:
        event - Holds the current event.

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent event)
        When the mouse will be dragged and it's a Pen new shape will be drawn, if it isn't a Pen the x2,y2 will always update and repaint to give a filling as the shape follows our mouse.
        See mouseDragged method: MouseMotionListener.mouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent).
        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface MouseMotionListener
        Overrides:
        mouseDragged in class MouseAdapter
        Parameters:
        event - Holds the current event.

      • mouseExited

        public void mouseExited(MouseEvent event)
        When the mouse will exit the DrawPanel it will set the status label.
        See mouseExited method: MouseAdapter.mouseExited(java.awt.event.MouseEvent).
        Specified by:
        mouseExited in interface MouseListener
        Overrides:
